reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked Hotel Raffaello based on reviews on TA and we really enjoyed our stay. We were lucky that we were given a large room on the top floor with a lovely balcony (it was our honeymoon), and when we arrived there was a bottle of wine & some nibbles waiting for us. As has been previously mentioned in other reviews we found the bed a bit firm for our liking, and the pillows I thought were rock hard, but apart from that, it was fantastic. I did find that one of the front desk staff members was a little unhelpful, or more accurately didn’t go out of their way to help with some of our questions – but the rest of the staff members we encountered were very helpful. We only ate breakfast at the hotel 2 mornings, and it was nice enough with little variety.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel was in an excellent location, right off Via Cavour, 10 min walk to the Termini train station and 10 mins to the Colosseum. The area surrounding the hotel was packed with lots of little restaurants, including the favourite of our stay, Restaurant Tema, and delis where you could get some lovely cheeses. We had originally planned to take the Terravision / Sitibus from the airport to Termini, but upon leaving the airport (Fiumicino) we asked how much a transfer was and at only 35 euros we decided that was probably better as it was quite late at night. We used the same company to transfer us to Ciampiono Airport at a cost of 40 euros (as it is further away).
reviews.title: Excellent Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean, comfortable room with good wi-fi connection. Staff was very friendly and helpful. As mentioned by other reviewers, close to the train station and colosseum, a bit distant to Campo de' Fiore, Piazza Navona, etc. Other comparable hotels were more expensive, so this was a very good value. Solid 3 star type of hotel.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel and breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the Raffaello hotel to meet all our needs. The room was very comfortable and even enjoyed the jacuzzi shower once we worked out how to use it! The location is excellent, 5 mins away from the Termini and the Colosseum and an easy walk to all other tourist locations. Especially enjoyed the breakfast which offered an assortment of pastries, cold meats, bread, scrambled eggs, fruit and cake. Yum Yum! Amazing cappuccino's!
reviews.title: A nice, if basic, value hotel in good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed here last week while spending 5 days in Rome.
reviews.title: A nice hotel except for one thing...the bed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great hotel. 5 minutes from the Colosseum and not more than a 10-15 minute walk from the other main attractions. Staff is great, helpful and friendly. Very small showers (perhaps a bit too small), but great water pressure. My only criticism is that while the first room we had was an acceptable size (not huge but not tiny), the second room was just way too small -- as in, the bed was pushed up against the wall because there was not enough room for it. But if you don't get that room (on the top floor), this is a wonderful hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed for three days and was very impressed with the hotel and the staff.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was excellent and breakfast superb.
reviews.title: Excellent, great value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very satisfied with our stay at Rafaello. Clean room good breakfast and very friendly staff. We have found our hotel in Rome for the future.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel - good last minute bargain

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Myself and my boyfriend stayed in this hotel for two nights in February. We found the regency style rooms and ensuite very spacious and clean. The minibar was reasonably priced and had a nice view onto the street. The location was not too far from the sights, there is plenty to take in while walking around so you dont even notice that you have been walking that far. The breakfast area is very nice but a little small so get to breakfast early, we made it down usually at 9.30 and had to squeeze in beside another table but we should have risen earlier to be fair. Good choice at the breakfast bar and staff were lovely. Just to note that there is no bar or restaurant in this hotel but you will find plenty nearby. There is internet but you need to pay (€3 for 30 mins)
reviews.title: Its a 4 Star Hotel at a 3 star price!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We purchased three rooms in the Raffaello as part of an Expedia package with friends based on price/reviews at their site. The hotel is OK, but nothing more. Daytime staff was friendly and helpful; evening staff was rude and incompetent (always talking on the phone while talking to us as well, not forthcoming with information, etc.). The public areas are well worn though clean; the rooms are adequate but nothing special: TV offered a couple of English news channels; bathroom lighting was poor; pillows were like rocks; the shower was tiny and designed so that water sprayed about the room when opening the door to start the water. The "business center" is a computer in a corner, no printer; wi-fi is extra charge. Breakfast doesn't begin until 7:00, and as we had early events we were unable to try it. The distance to Termini is quite walkable and felt safe, thought the return to the station is all up hill. We walked from the Raffaello to the Vatican via lunch and many sights, taking the metro back to the Termini; it was convenient but a good hike.
reviews.title: OK, but must be something better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011
reviews.text: Were we to return to Rome, we would first consider other hotels but would return if the price and availability made the Raffaello "special." It's OK, but we suspect there are many better options.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lovely hotel with attentive staff. We stayed in a triple room with my elderly grandma...it didn't have a great view but that's not what we were there for. The beds were comfortable, the breakfast was an amazing start to the day. You will not regret staying here xx
reviews.title: my first choice in Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights. Close to Termini main train station. Short walk to next underground. Great hotel. Had special price. Absolutely super value for money. Rooms very nice. Great Breakfast. Good service. Friendly staff.
reviews.title: Great hotel, well located, friendly staff!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011
reviews.text: Would recommend it to my friends.
reviews.title: Choose this without any concerns

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wondeful time in Rome and the Raffaello was a great home base sanctuary. The room, location, breakfast and price were all wonderful! We would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Great location, great hotel and great breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Laura & Peter
reviews.title: Raffaello was okay except for air-conditioning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here 4 nights end of August. Our first impression was "it's okay" but then we had to carry our bags up to our room (no bell boy). The air conditioner was very bad, we wished we could have slept in the hall way cuz it was cooler. The breakfast was disapointing, nothing substantial. The next thing that annoyed us was when we asked for an iron the consierge said that they were affraid we would burn down the hotel!!! We would never stay there again, but it was an experience.
reviews.title: Worse than expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: My Mum and I spent 4 fantastic days in Rome celebrating her 50th Birthday. We chose the Raffaello Hotel based on the brilliant reviews on Trip and we were very pleased with the results! From the moment we arrived we received wonderful service. In particular the warm welcome we received from Francesca on our arrival, ensuring the room was ready even upon our early arrival and the beautiful flowers as pre-arranged with Alex. Also a very special mention to Massimo for arranging a wonderful meal for my Mums birthday (the HiRes) and for letting the restaurant know about the special occasion as they provided a cake and Prosecco! The only thing that prevents us from giving ‘Excellent’ marks is the fact that outside of breakfast you cannot get a drink at the hotel, but there are many nice coffee bars nearby.
reviews.title: Excellant Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Raffaello for a week during our vacation to Rome in March. The staff was very nice, and our room was big and very clean. The location is great, it’s on a small street that is parallel to Via Cavour. We were a 10 minute walk to the Colosseum, Palantine Hill, the Roman Forum, Trevi Fountain and Termini Station. We were a 30 minute walk to the Vatican, if you don’t want to walk, there is a Metro Station (B Line)down the street on Cavour. Every morning they served breakfast from 7-10 a.m. and had a variety of cereal, yogurt, fruit, eggs, pastries, coffee, tea, water and juice. Great way to start your morning. There are restaurants and shops to buy food very close to the hotel. My only complaint about the hotel is that our stall shower was very small. My husband and I are not big people and we both had some trouble moving around in it. All and all, an excellent hotel, I would highly recommend and will stay there again when we’re in Rome.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Close to Termini, 10 min walk, and St Maria Maggiore.
reviews.title: Good location and great breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006
reviews.text: Family room booked and got 2 adjoining rooms, a double and a twin, which was perfect for us.
reviews.title: Nice Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We booked this hotel based on the glowing reviews on TA. It was the last hotel we were staying in during our month around Europe and based on the reviews arrived with great anticipation.
reviews.title: Good - but not outstanding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the family room which as previously described is divided into two smaller rooms. This was suitable for our family of four and the bathroom although small provided everything we needed. (we didn't find the shower too small as others have indicated.). Our room had no street view which was a little disappointing but being back from the street probably enhanced our sleep as there was very little noise.
reviews.title: we can really recommend this hotel and will come back again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: The breakfast was OK but not worth the glowing reviews it has received. It lacked fresh fruit and the variety we found at other 3 star hotels across Germany and Austria. The most disappointing aspect was the demenour of the front desk staff. We didn't ask a lot of them and They were professional, but given the rave reviews about them we had high expectations that they did not meet. They certainly answered any question but we always felt that we were putting them out by requesting information and the answer we got was straight out of the tourist guide with no additional information, service or guidance. An example of this was when we inquired if the guest computer was linked to a printer so we could print out our flight boarding passes. We were informed that it wasn't and that we would have to go to an intent cafe to access a printer with Internet access. This was despite one sitting at the front desk which we would have happily paid to use. Given the reviews this request didn't seem to big an ask.
reviews.title: Raffaello Hotel -Great location and Rooms, internet and front desk not up to par

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Overall I would stay there again, but would not automatically go back without looking around and comparing other hotels, as it did not live up to the TA reviews.
reviews.title: Two different rooms, lovely location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010
reviews.text: Friendly personnel; very clean, comfortable,big and cosy rooms,nice interior, breakfast offers a good variation of food for the international guests. Hotel is located in the centre of rom and near main station and yet the rooms are quiet. the price for the rooms are fair. We booked this hotel because of the good rating at tripadvisor - we were very satisfied and we will definitely come back.
reviews.title: Perfectly situated, friendly staff, warm atmosphere- perfecto!!
